newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Spring/White Wheat - Most bids climb higher.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Spring/White Wheat - Most bids climb higher.

text.p: Most bids for spring wheat in U.S. cash markets were slightly higher Monday on a slowdown in farmer sales triggered by bullish crop concerns, dealers said.
"It was very, very quiet," one Montana dealer said. "The farmers out here are all very bullish."
Severe flooding in the U.S. Northern Plains has generated concerns that there will be long delays in planting the U.S. spring wheat crop, and many see a switch to soybeans.
On Sunday, a U.S. Congressman said 1.7 million acres of cropland in North Dakota was under water.
"Everybody's worried about whether or not the wheat will get in," another Montana dealer said.
Spring wheat on the Minneapolis Grain Exchange rallied to new contract highs on the flooding concerns, traders said.
Price per bushel for 14-pct protein dark northern spring, durum and white wheats, in dollars per bushel:
Spring Chg Durum(m) Chg White Chg
Spring Chg HRW 13pct Chg White Chg
